intro: Mitrasacme connata, commonly known as the Florida mitrasacme, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands. Its flowers are usually blue or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. Mitrasacme connata is a rare species, often found in specific habitats, making it of interest to botanists and conservationists.
